body_html:
It's not so much about adding those annotations to all members of those modules (that's probably quite hard), but just to the file where those members are defined. You'll also have to modify the C++ code, since this is where this code lives.

Also, if __file__ is already used in Python for other purposes, maybe it's safer to go with __source__.
body_text:
It's not so much about adding those annotations to all members of those modules (that's probably quite hard), but just to the file where those members are defined. You'll also have to modify the C++ code, since this is where this code lives.
Also, if __file__ is already used in Python for other purposes, maybe it's safer to go with __source__.
body:
It's not so much about adding those annotations to all members of those modules (that's probably quite hard), but just to the file where those members are defined. You'll also have to modify the C++ code, since this is where this code lives.

Also, if `__file__` is already used in Python for other purposes, maybe it's safer to go with `__source__`.
